title: Florida, Utah Take on ESG Farce
sub_head: If you thought Disney made the ‘corporate social responsibility’ crowd look bad, how about Russia?
body:
Florida’s effort to defend its schools against the Walt Disney Co. has exposed the empty rhetoric of “stakeholder capitalism.” Now Utah is shining a light on the broader movement for “corporate social responsibility.” In both cases, aggressive virtue signals may conceal political agendas that are not in the interest of consumers, investors, workers or voters. Moreover, attempts to grade companies on how responsible they are have recently yielded results that are almost beyond belief.
Karen Pierog reports in the Bond Buyer on Utah’s scrap with one of the credit-ratings giants:
